translations.idiomatic: Each has its appointed time.

sentences.zh: 其後二歲，或曰周興而邑邰，立后稷之祠，至今血食天下。

translations.literal: After two years, some say Zhou rose and established the city of Tai, established the sacrifice to Hou Ji, and to this day receives sacrificial offerings throughout the empire.
translations.idiomatic: Two years later, some say the Zhou dynasty rose, established the city of Tai, and set up sacrifices to Hou Ji, who to this day receives offerings throughout the realm.

sentences.zh: 於是高祖制詔御史：「其令郡國縣立靈星祠，常以歲時祠以牛。」

translations.literal: Then Gaozu issued an imperial decree to the Imperial Secretary: "Order the commanderies, kingdoms, and counties to establish the Lingxing sacrifice, and regularly sacrifice to it with oxen at the seasons."
translations.idiomatic: Then Gaozu issued a decree to the imperial secretary: "Have the commanderies, kingdoms, and counties establish sacrifices to the Spirit Star, and regularly offer oxen in sacrifice at the appropriate seasons."

sentences.zh: 高祖十年春，有司請令縣常以春（三）［二］月及（時）臘祠社稷以羊豕，民里社各自財以祠。

translations.literal: In the tenth year of Gaozu, spring, the officials requested to order the counties to regularly in spring [second] month and at [the time of] la sacrifice to the Sheji with sheep and pigs, and the people of the li and she to each use their own wealth to sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year of Gaozu, spring, the officials petitioned to have the counties regularly sacrifice to the Sheji with sheep and pigs in the second month of spring and at the La festival, with the people of each neighborhood and village using their own resources for the sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 制曰：「可。」

translations.literal: The decree said: "Approved."
translations.idiomatic: The decree stated: "Approved."

sentences.zh: 其後十八年，孝文帝即位。

translations.literal: Eighteen years later, Emperor Xiaowen ascended the throne.
translations.idiomatic: Eighteen years later, Emperor Xiaowen took the throne.

sentences.zh: 即位十三年，下詔曰：「今祕祝移過于下，朕甚不取。

translations.literal: After ascending thirteen years, he issued an edict saying: "Now the secret prayers transfer calamities to subordinates, I greatly do not approve.
translations.idiomatic: Thirteen years after ascending the throne, he issued an edict: "Now the secret prayers transfer misfortunes to subordinates, I greatly disapprove.

sentences.zh: 自今除之。」

translations.literal: From now on eliminate it."
translations.idiomatic: From now on, abolish this practice."

sentences.zh: 始名山大川在諸侯，諸侯祝各自奉祠，天子官不領。

translations.literal: Originally famous mountains and great rivers were in the feudal lords, the feudal lords' priests each conducted sacrifices, the Son of Heaven's officials did not oversee.
translations.idiomatic: Originally the famous mountains and great rivers were under the feudal lords' jurisdiction, with each lord's priests conducting their own sacrifices, and the emperor's officials not overseeing them.

sentences.zh: 及齊、淮南國廢，令太祝盡以歲時致禮如故。

translations.literal: When the kingdoms of Qi and Huainan were abolished, he ordered the Grand Priest to completely perform the rituals at the seasons as before.
translations.idiomatic: When the kingdoms of Qi and Huainan were abolished, he ordered the Grand Priest to continue performing all the seasonal rituals as before.

sentences.zh: 是歲，制曰：「朕即位十三年于今，賴宗廟之靈，社稷之福，方內艾安，民人靡疾。

translations.literal: This year, the decree said: "I have been on the throne thirteen years now, relying on the spirits of the ancestral temples, the blessings of the Sheji, within the borders there is peace and security, the people have no illnesses.
translations.idiomatic: That year, the decree stated: "I have now been on the throne thirteen years, relying on the spirits of the ancestral temples and the blessings of the Sheji, with peace and security within the borders and the people free from illness.

sentences.zh: 閒者比年登，朕之不德，何以饗此？

translations.literal: Recently year after year there have been good harvests, my lack of virtue, how can I enjoy this?
translations.idiomatic: Recently there have been good harvests year after year; given my lack of virtue, how can I enjoy such bounty?

sentences.zh: 皆上帝諸神之賜也。

translations.literal: All are the gifts of the Supreme God and the various spirits.
translations.idiomatic: All of this is due to the blessings of the Supreme God and the various deities.

sentences.zh: 蓋聞古者饗其德必報其功，欲有增諸神祠。

translations.literal: I have heard that the ancients, when enjoying virtue, must repay merit, and desire to increase the sacrifices to the various spirits.
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that in ancient times, when one enjoyed virtue, one must repay merit, and so I wish to add to the sacrifices for the various deities.

sentences.zh: 有司議增雍五畤路車各一乘，駕被具；

translations.literal: The officials discussed increasing Yong's five zhi with chariots each one team, harness coverings complete;
translations.idiomatic: The officials proposed adding one chariot each to Yong's five zhi altars, complete with harnesses and coverings;

sentences.zh: 西畤畦畤禺車各一乘，禺馬四匹，駕被具；

translations.literal: Western zhi, Qi zhi yu chariots each one team, yu horses four, harness coverings complete;
translations.idiomatic: For the Western Altar and Qi Altar, one yu chariot each with four yu horses, complete with harnesses and coverings;

sentences.zh: 其河、湫、漢水加玉各二；

translations.literal: For the Yellow River, spring, Han River add jade each two;
translations.idiomatic: For the Yellow River, springs, and Han River, add two pieces of jade each;

sentences.zh: 及諸祠，各增廣壇場，珪幣俎豆以差加之。

translations.literal: And for the various sacrifices, each expand and broaden the altar grounds, gui, bi, zu, dou according to rank add to them.
translations.idiomatic: And for all the various sacrifices, expand and enlarge the altar grounds, adding gui tablets, bi silks, zu stands, and dou vessels according to their rank.

sentences.zh: 而祝祕者歸福於朕，百姓不與焉。

translations.literal: And the secret-praying priests return blessings to Me, the common people do not participate in them.
translations.idiomatic: And the priests who perform secret prayers shall direct blessings to Me; the common people shall not participate.

sentences.zh: 自今祝致敬，毋有所祈。」

translations.literal: From now on priests offer respect, do not make any prayers."
translations.idiomatic: From now on, let the priests offer respect without making any prayers."

sentences.zh: 魯人公孫臣上書曰：「始秦得水德，今漢受之，推終始傳，則漢當土德，土德之應黃龍見。

translations.literal: The man from Lu, Gongsun Chen, submitted a memorial saying: "Originally Qin obtained water virtue, now Han receives it, pushing the cycle of beginnings and ends transmission, then Han should be earth virtue, earth virtue's response yellow dragon appears.
translations.idiomatic: Gongsun Chen from Lu submitted a memorial: "Originally Qin possessed the water virtue; now Han inherits it. Following the cycle of the five virtues, Han should possess the earth virtue, and the sign of earth virtue is the appearance of a yellow dragon.

sentences.zh: 宜改正朔，易服色，色上黃。」

translations.literal: Should correct the calendar, change clothing colors, color above yellow."
translations.idiomatic: We should reform the calendar, change the ritual colors, with yellow as the primary color."

sentences.zh: 是時丞相張蒼好律歷，以為漢乃水德之始，故河決金隄，其符也。

translations.literal: At this time Chancellor Zhang Cang liked laws and calendars, thought Han was water virtue's beginning, therefore Yellow River broke Golden Dike, this was its sign.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Chancellor Zhang Cang was fond of legal codes and calendars; he believed Han represented the beginning of the water virtue, which was why the Yellow River broke through the Golden Dike—this was its omen.

sentences.zh: 年始冬十月，色外黑內赤，與德相應。

translations.literal: Year begins winter tenth month, color outside black inside red, matches the virtue.
translations.idiomatic: The year begins in the tenth month of winter, with colors black outside and red inside, corresponding to the virtue.

sentences.zh: 如公孫臣言，非也。

translations.literal: Like Gongsun Chen said, it is not so.
translations.idiomatic: As Gongsun Chen said, it is not.

sentences.zh: 罷之。

translations.literal: Dismissed it.
translations.idiomatic: He dismissed it.

sentences.zh: 後三歲，黃龍見成紀。

translations.literal: After three years, yellow dragon appeared at Chengji.
translations.idiomatic: Three years later, a yellow dragon appeared at Chengji.

sentences.zh: 文帝乃召公孫臣，拜為博士，與諸生草改歷服色事。

translations.literal: Wen Di then summoned Gongsun Chen, appointed him as erudite, with the various scholars drafted changing calendar clothing color matters.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen then summoned Gongsun Chen and appointed him as an erudite, having him and the other scholars draft proposals for reforming the calendar and ritual colors.

sentences.zh: 其夏，下詔曰：「異物之神見于成紀，無害於民，歲以有年。

translations.literal: That summer, issued an edict saying: "Strange creature's spirit appeared at Chengji, no harm to the people, the year will have good harvest.
translations.idiomatic: That summer, he issued an edict: "A divine being in strange form appeared at Chengji; it brings no harm to the people, and the year will bring good harvests.

sentences.zh: 朕祈郊上帝諸神，禮官議，無諱以勞朕。」

translations.literal: I pray to the suburban Supreme God and various spirits, the ritual officials discuss, do not avoid speaking to tire Me."
translations.idiomatic: I pray to the Supreme God and various deities in the suburbs; let the ritual officials deliberate without hesitation, even if it tires Me."

sentences.zh: 有司皆曰「古者天子夏親郊，祀上帝於郊，故曰郊」。

translations.literal: The officials all said "In ancient times the Son of Heaven in summer personally performed the suburban sacrifice, sacrificed to the Supreme God in the suburbs, therefore called suburban".
translations.idiomatic: All the officials said: "In ancient times, the emperor personally performed the suburban sacrifice in summer, offering sacrifices to the Supreme God in the suburbs, which is why it is called 'suburban'."

sentences.zh: 於是夏四月，文帝始郊見雍五畤祠，衣皆上赤。

translations.literal: Then summer fourth month, Wen Di began suburban audience Yong five zhi sacrifice, clothing all upper red.
translations.idiomatic: Then in the fourth month of summer, Emperor Wen began performing the suburban sacrifice at Yong's five zhi altars, with all clothing in the upper red color.

sentences.zh: 其明年，趙人新垣平以望氣見上，言「長安東北有神氣，成五采，若人冠絻焉。

translations.literal: The next year, the man from Zhao, Xin Yuang Ping, by observing vapors appeared before the emperor, said "Chang'an northeast has divine vapor, forms five colors, like a person's hat tassel there.
translations.idiomatic: The following year, Xin Yuang Ping from Zhao appeared before the emperor through his skill in observing vapors, saying: "To the northeast of Chang'an there is a divine aura forming five colors, like a tassel on a person's hat.

sentences.zh: 或曰東北神明之舍，西方神明之墓也。

translations.literal: Some say northeast divine spirits' dwelling, western divine spirits' tomb also.
translations.idiomatic: Some say it is the dwelling place of divine spirits in the northeast, and the tomb of divine spirits in the west.

sentences.zh: 天瑞下，宜立祠上帝，以合符應」。

translations.literal: Heavenly auspicious sign descends, should establish sacrifice to Supreme God, to match the omen response".
translations.idiomatic: A heavenly auspicious sign has descended; we should establish sacrifices to the Supreme God to match this omen."

sentences.zh: 於是作渭陽五帝廟，同宇，帝一殿，面各五門，各如其帝色。

translations.literal: Then built Wei Yang five emperors temple, same building, emperor one hall, facing each five gates, each like their emperor color.
translations.idiomatic: Then they built the Temple of the Five Emperors at Wei Yang, under the same roof, with one hall per emperor, each facing five gates, and each colored according to their emperor's virtue.

sentences.zh: 祠所用及儀亦如雍五畤。

translations.literal: Sacrifice place used and ceremonies also like Yong five zhi.
translations.idiomatic: The sacrificial implements and ceremonies were the same as those for Yong's five zhi altars.

sentences.zh: 夏四月，文帝親拜霸渭之會，以郊見渭陽五帝。

translations.literal: Summer fourth month, Wen Di personally bowed at the Ba Wei meeting place, to suburban audience Wei Yang five emperors.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of summer, Emperor Wen personally performed the suburban sacrifice to the Five Emperors of Wei Yang at the meeting place of the Ba and Wei rivers.

sentences.zh: 五帝廟南臨渭，北穿蒲池溝水，權火舉而祠，若光煇然屬天焉。

translations.literal: Five emperors temple south faces Wei, north pierces Pu Pool ditch water, torch fire raised and sacrificed, like light splendor connecting to heaven there.
translations.idiomatic: The Temple of the Five Emperors faced south toward the Wei River, pierced north through the waters of the Pu Pool ditch; torches were raised for the sacrifices, their light splendor seeming to connect with heaven.

sentences.zh: 於是貴平上大夫，賜累千金。

translations.literal: Then honored Ping as upper grand master, granted accumulated thousand gold.
translations.idiomatic: Then Ping was honored as an upper grand master and granted riches totaling a thousand pieces of gold.

sentences.zh: 而使博士諸生刺六經中作王制，謀議巡狩封禪事。

translations.literal: And caused the erudite various scholars to excerpt from the six classics to make king regulations, discuss and deliberate inspection tours feng shan matters.
translations.idiomatic: And he had the erudites and scholars excerpt from the Six Classics to compose royal regulations, discussing and deliberating matters of imperial tours and feng-shan sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 文帝出長門，若見五人於道北，遂因其直北立五帝壇，祠以五牢具。

translations.literal: Wen Di exited the Chang Gate, seemingly saw five persons north of the road, then following their straight north established five emperors altar, sacrificed with five sets of livestock.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wen exited through the Chang Gate and seemed to see five persons to the north of the road; following this direction, he established an altar to the Five Emperors straight to the north and sacrificed with five sets of livestock.

sentences.zh: 其明年，新垣平使人持玉杯，上書闕下獻之。

translations.literal: The next year, Xin Yuang Ping sent a person holding jade cup, submitted memorial at palace gate offered it.
translations.idiomatic: The following year, Xin Yuang Ping sent someone holding a jade cup and submitted a memorial at the palace gate offering it.

sentences.zh: 平言上曰：「闕下有寶玉氣來者。」

translations.literal: Ping spoke to the emperor saying: "Palace gate has precious jade vapor coming there."
translations.idiomatic: Ping told the emperor: "There is an aura of precious jade coming toward the palace gate."

sentences.zh: 已視之，果有獻玉杯者，刻曰「人主延壽」。

translations.literal: Already inspected it, indeed there was one offering jade cup, engraved saying "Ruler extends longevity".
translations.idiomatic: When they inspected it, there was indeed someone offering a jade cup, engraved with the words "The ruler shall have extended longevity."

sentences.zh: 平又言「臣候日再中」。

translations.literal: Ping also said "Your servant awaits the sun to be double noon".
translations.idiomatic: Ping further said: "Your servant awaits the sun to culminate twice at noon."

sentences.zh: 居頃之，日卻復中。

translations.literal: After a short while, the sun retreated and again culminated.
translations.idiomatic: After a short time, the sun retreated and culminated again.

sentences.zh: 於是始更以十七年為元年，令天下大酺。

translations.literal: Then began changing to make seventeen year as first year, ordered the empire great drinking feast.
translations.idiomatic: Then he began changing the calendar to make the seventeenth year the first year, and ordered a great drinking feast throughout the empire.

sentences.zh: 平言曰：「周鼎亡在泗水中，今河溢通泗，臣望東北汾陰直有金寶氣，意周鼎其出乎？

translations.literal: Ping said: "Zhou tripod lost in Si River water, now Yellow River overflows connects Si, your servant looks northeast Fen Yin straight has gold treasure vapor, perhaps Zhou tripod will emerge?
translations.idiomatic: Ping said: "The Zhou tripod was lost in the waters of the Si River; now the Yellow River has overflowed and connects with the Si. Your servant sees to the northeast at Fen Yin a straight line of gold and treasure vapors—perhaps the Zhou tripod will emerge?

sentences.zh: 兆見不迎則不至。」

translations.literal: Omen appears not welcome then not arrive."
translations.idiomatic: When an omen appears, if you do not welcome it, it will not come."

sentences.zh: 於是上使使治廟汾陰南，臨河，欲祠出周鼎。

translations.literal: Then the emperor sent envoys to build temple south of Fen Yin, facing the river, wishing to sacrifice to bring out Zhou tripod.
translations.idiomatic: Then the emperor sent officials to build a temple south of Fen Yin, facing the river, hoping to sacrifice and bring forth the Zhou tripod.

sentences.zh: 人有上書告新垣平所言氣神事皆詐也。

translations.literal: Someone submitted memorial accusing Xin Yuang Ping's said vapor spirit matters all fraud also.
translations.idiomatic: Someone submitted a memorial accusing Xin Yuang Ping of fabricating all the matters concerning vapors and spirits.

sentences.zh: 下平吏治，誅夷新垣平。

translations.literal: Sent Ping to judicial officials for treatment, executed and exterminated Xin Yuang Ping.
translations.idiomatic: Ping was handed over to the judicial officials for investigation, and Xin Yuang Ping was executed.

sentences.zh: 自是之後，文帝怠於改正朔服色神明之事，而渭陽、長門五帝使祠官領，以時致禮，不往焉。

translations.literal: From this after, Wen Di was lax about correcting calendar clothing color divine spirit matters, and Wei Yang, Chang Gate five emperors had sacrifice officials oversee, at times performed rituals, did not go there.
translations.idiomatic: After this, Emperor Wen became lax about matters of reforming the calendar, ritual colors, and divine spirits; the Five Emperors of Wei Yang and Chang Gate were overseen by sacrifice officials who performed the rituals at the proper times, but he did not go there himself.

sentences.zh: 明年，匈奴數入邊，興兵守御。

translations.literal: Next year, Xiongnu frequently entered borders, raised troops to guard and defend.
translations.idiomatic: The following year, the Xiongnu frequently invaded the borders, so troops were raised to guard and defend.

sentences.zh: 後歲少不登。

translations.literal: Later years slightly not good harvest.
translations.idiomatic: In subsequent years, the harvests were poor.

sentences.zh: 數年而孝景即位。

translations.literal: Several years and Xiao Jing ascended throne.
translations.idiomatic: Several years later, Emperor Xiaojing ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 十六年，祠官各以歲時祠如故，無有所興，至今天子。

translations.literal: Sixteen years, sacrifice officials each at seasonal times sacrificed as before, nothing new raised, until today's emperor.
translations.idiomatic: For sixteen years, the sacrifice officials each performed sacrifices at the proper seasonal times as before, with nothing new being established, until the present emperor.

sentences.zh: 今天子初即位，尤敬鬼神之祀。

translations.literal: Today's emperor newly ascended throne, especially reveres ghost spirit sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: The present emperor, newly ascended to the throne, especially reveres the sacrifices to ghosts and spirits.

sentences.zh: 元年，漢興已六十餘歲矣，天下艾安，搢紳之屬皆望天子封禪改正度也，而上鄉儒術，招賢良，趙綰、王臧等以文學為公卿，欲議古立明堂城南，以朝諸侯。

translations.literal: First year, Han rise already sixty remaining years, world peaceful secure, noble scholar class all hoped emperor feng shan correct regulations, and emperor inclined Confucian arts, summoned worthy good, Zhao Wan, Wang Zang etc. with literature became ministers, wished discuss ancient establish bright hall south of city, to receive feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year, the Han dynasty had already risen for over sixty years; the world was peaceful and secure. The noble scholars all hoped the emperor would perform feng and shan sacrifices and reform the regulations. The emperor inclined toward Confucian teachings, summoned worthy men, and made Zhao Wan, Wang Zang, and others ministers based on their literary accomplishments, intending to discuss establishing an ancient-style Mingtang hall south of the city to receive the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 草巡狩封禪改歷服色事未就。

translations.literal: Drafted imperial tours feng shan change calendar clothing color matters not completed.
translations.idiomatic: The drafted plans for imperial tours, feng-shan sacrifices, and changes to the calendar and ritual colors were not completed.

sentences.zh: 會竇太后治黃老言，不好儒術，使人微伺得趙綰等姦利事，召案綰、臧，綰、臧自殺，諸所興為皆廢。

translations.literal: Coincided Dou Empress Dowager governed Huang Lao teachings, disliked Confucian arts, sent people secretly spy obtained Zhao Wan etc. illicit profit matters, summoned investigated Wan, Zang, Wan, Zang committed suicide, all undertakings abolished.
translations.idiomatic: It happened that Empress Dowager Dou governed according to Huang-Lao teachings and disliked Confucian arts; she sent people to secretly spy and obtained evidence of illicit dealings by Zhao Wan and others. She summoned and investigated Wan and Zang; Wan and Zang committed suicide, and all their undertakings were abolished.

sentences.zh: 後六年，竇太后崩。

translations.literal: After six years, Dou Empress Dowager passed away.
translations.idiomatic: Six years later, Empress Dowager Dou passed away.

sentences.zh: 其明年，徵文學之士公孫弘等。

translations.literal: The next year, summoned literary scholars Gongsun Hong etc.
translations.idiomatic: The following year, he summoned literary scholars like Gongsun Hong.

sentences.zh: 明年，今上初至雍，郊見五畤。

translations.literal: Next year, current emperor first went to Yong, suburban audience five zhi.
translations.idiomatic: The following year, the current emperor first went to Yong and performed the suburban sacrifice to the five zhi altars.

sentences.zh: 後常三歲一郊。

translations.literal: After regularly three years one suburban sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: Thereafter, he regularly performed the suburban sacrifice once every three years.

sentences.zh: 是時上求神君，捨之上林中蹄氏觀。

translations.literal: At this time emperor sought divine lord, lodged in Shanglin Park Ti Shi pavilion.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, the emperor sought the Divine Lord and lodged her in the Ti Shi pavilion in the Shanglin Park.

sentences.zh: 神君者，長陵女子，以子死，見神於先後宛若。

translations.literal: Divine lord was Changling woman, died from childbirth, appeared to god to late husband Wan Ruo.
translations.idiomatic: The Divine Lord was a woman from Changling who died in childbirth; she appeared as a spirit to her late husband Wan Ruo.

sentences.zh: 宛若祠之其室，民多往祠。

translations.literal: Wan Ruo sacrificed to her in his room, people many went to sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: Wan Ruo sacrificed to her in his chamber, and many people went to sacrifice there.

sentences.zh: 平原君往祠，其後子孫以尊顯。

translations.literal: Pingyuan Jun went to sacrifice, his later descendants became honored and eminent.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Pingyuan went to sacrifice there, and his descendants later became honored and eminent.

sentences.zh: 及今上即位，則厚禮置祠之內中。

translations.literal: When current emperor ascended throne, then with generous rites placed sacrifice in inner palace.
translations.idiomatic: When the current emperor ascended the throne, he established sacrifices to her in the inner palace with generous rites.

sentences.zh: 聞其言，不見其人云。

translations.literal: Heard her words, did not see her person it is said.
translations.idiomatic: One could hear her words but not see her person, they say.

sentences.zh: 是時李少君亦以祠灶、穀道、卻老方見上，上尊之。

translations.literal: At this time Li Shaojun also with stove sacrifice, grain path, dispel old age methods appeared before emperor, emperor honored him.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Li Shaojun also appeared before the emperor with methods for sacrificing to the stove god, grain spirits, and dispelling old age, and the emperor honored him.

sentences.zh: 少君者，故深澤侯舍人，主方。

translations.literal: Shaojun was former Shenze Marquis retainer, master of methods.
translations.idiomatic: Shaojun was a former retainer of the Marquis of Shenze and a master of esoteric methods.

sentences.zh: 匿其年及其生長，常自謂七十，能使物，卻老。

translations.literal: Concealed his age and upbringing, constantly claimed seventy, could manipulate things, dispel old age.
translations.idiomatic: He concealed his age and background, constantly claiming to be seventy, able to manipulate objects and dispel old age.

sentences.zh: 其游以方遍諸侯。

translations.literal: His travels with methods widespread among feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: He traveled widely among the feudal lords with his esoteric methods.

sentences.zh: 無妻子。

translations.literal: No wife children.
translations.idiomatic: He had no wife or children.

sentences.zh: 人聞其能使物及不死，更饋遺之，常餘金錢衣食。

translations.literal: People heard his ability to manipulate things and immortality, moreover sent gifts to him, constantly surplus gold money clothing food.
translations.idiomatic: People heard of his ability to manipulate objects and achieve immortality, and moreover sent him gifts, so he constantly had surplus gold, money, clothing, and food.

sentences.zh: 人皆以為不治生業而饒給，又不知其何所人，愈信，爭事之。

translations.literal: People all thought not managing livelihood yet wealthy, moreover did not know where he came from, even more believed, competed to serve him.
translations.idiomatic: People all thought he did not manage any livelihood yet lived in abundance, and moreover did not know where he came from; they believed even more and competed to serve him.

sentences.zh: 少君資好方，善為巧發奇中。

translations.literal: Shaojun naturally fond of methods, skilled at cleverly predicting extraordinary hits.
translations.idiomatic: Shaojun was naturally fond of esoteric methods and skilled at making clever predictions that miraculously came true.

sentences.zh: 嘗從武安侯飲，坐中有九十餘老人，少君乃言與其大父游射處，老人為兒時從其大父，識其處，一坐盡驚。

translations.literal: Once followed Wuan Hou drinking, in seat had ninety remaining old man, Shaojun then spoke of place where played archery with his grandfather, old man as child followed his grandfather, knew that place, whole seat all astonished.
translations.idiomatic: Once while drinking with the Marquis of Wuan, there was a man over ninety in the company. Shaojun spoke of a place where he had played archery with the man's grandfather; the old man had followed his grandfather there as a child and recognized the place, astonishing everyone present.

sentences.zh: 少君見上，上有故銅器，問少君。

translations.literal: Shaojun appeared before emperor, emperor had old bronze vessel, asked Shaojun.
translations.idiomatic: Shaojun appeared before the emperor; the emperor had an old bronze vessel and asked Shaojun about it.

sentences.zh: 少君曰：「此器齊桓公十年陳於柏寢。」

translations.literal: Shaojun said: "This vessel Duke Huan of Qi tenth year displayed in cypress chamber."
translations.idiomatic: Shaojun said: "This vessel was displayed by Duke Huan of Qi in his cypress chamber in the tenth year."

sentences.zh: 已而案其刻，果齊桓公器。

translations.literal: Then examined its inscriptions, indeed Duke Huan of Qi vessel.
translations.idiomatic: Then they examined the inscriptions, and indeed it was a vessel from Duke Huan of Qi's time.

sentences.zh: 一宮盡駭，以為少君神，數百歲人也。

translations.literal: Whole palace all terrified, thought Shaojun divine, several hundred year person.
translations.idiomatic: The entire palace was terrified, believing Shaojun to be divine, a man several hundred years old.

sentences.zh: 少君言上曰：「祠灶則致物，致物而丹沙可化為黃金，黃金成以為飲食器則益壽，益壽而海中蓬萊僊者乃可見，見之以封禪則不死，黃帝是也。

translations.literal: Shaojun spoke to emperor saying: "Sacrifice stove then bring objects, bring objects and cinnabar sand can transform to gold, gold formed made into eating drinking vessels then increase longevity, increase longevity and sea middle Penglai immortals then can be seen, see them with feng shan then immortal, Yellow Emperor is this.
translations.idiomatic: Shaojun told the emperor: "By sacrificing to the stove god one can summon spirits; once spirits are summoned, cinnabar and sand can be transformed into gold. When gold is formed and made into eating and drinking vessels, it increases longevity. With increased longevity, the immortals of Penglai in the sea can be seen; seeing them and performing feng-shan sacrifices leads to immortality, as was the case with the Yellow Emperor.

sentences.zh: 臣嘗游海上，見安期生，安期生食巨棗，大如瓜。

translations.literal: Your servant once traveled on sea, saw An Qisheng, An Qisheng ate giant dates, large like melons."
translations.idiomatic: Your servant once traveled on the sea and saw An Qisheng; An Qisheng ate giant dates as large as melons."

sentences.zh: 安期生僊者，通蓬萊中，合則見人，不合則隱。」

translations.literal: An Qisheng immortal, communicates Penglai middle, when harmonious then appears to people, not harmonious then hides."
translations.idiomatic: An Qisheng is an immortal who communicates with Penglai; when conditions are right he appears to people, when not, he hides."

sentences.zh: 於是天子始親祠灶，遣方士入海求蓬萊安期生之屬，而事化丹沙諸藥齊為黃金矣。

translations.literal: Then Son of Heaven began personally sacrifice stove, sent alchemists enter sea seek Penglai An Qisheng and the like, and engaged in transforming cinnabar sand various medicines all to gold.
translations.idiomatic: Then the emperor began personally sacrificing to the stove god, sent alchemists into the sea to seek An Qisheng and others of Penglai, and engaged in the practice of transforming cinnabar, sand, and various medicines into gold.

sentences.zh: 居久之，李少君病死。

translations.literal: After long time, Li Shaojun illness died.
translations.idiomatic: After a long time, Li Shaojun fell ill and died.

sentences.zh: 天子以為化去不死，而使黃錘史寬舒受其方。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven thought transformed away immortal, and caused Huang Hammer Official Kuanshu receive his methods.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor believed he had transformed and ascended to immortality, and had the official Kuanshu of the Yellow Hammer receive his methods.

sentences.zh: 求蓬萊安期生莫能得，而海上燕齊怪迂之方士多更來言神事矣。

translations.literal: Sought Penglai An Qisheng none could obtain, and seacoast Yan Qi strange circuitous alchemists many moreover came speak divine matters.
translations.idiomatic: They sought An Qisheng of Penglai but could not find him, and many more alchemists from the seacoast regions of Yan and Qi, with their strange and circuitous ways, came to speak of divine matters.

sentences.zh: 亳人謬忌奏祠太一方，曰：「天神貴者太一，太一佐曰五帝。

translations.literal: Bo person Miao Ji memorialed sacrifice Tai Yi methods, said: "Heaven spirits honored is Tai Yi, Tai Yi assistants called five emperors.
translations.idiomatic: Miao Ji from Bo submitted a memorial on methods for sacrificing to Tai Yi: "The most honored of the heavenly spirits is Tai Yi, and Tai Yi's assistants are called the Five Emperors.

sentences.zh: 古者天子以春秋祭太一東南郊，用太牢，七日，為壇開八通之鬼道。」

translations.literal: Ancient Son of Heaven with spring autumn sacrificed Tai Yi southeast suburb, used great livestock, seven days, made altar opened eight directions ghost paths."
translations.idiomatic: In ancient times, the emperor sacrificed to Tai Yi in the southeast suburb during spring and autumn, using great livestock offerings, for seven days, and made an altar that opened eight paths for the ghosts."

sentences.zh: 於是天子令太祝立其祠長安東南郊，常奉祠如忌方。

translations.literal: Then Son of Heaven ordered Grand Priest establish his sacrifice Chang'an southeast suburb, constantly perform sacrifice like Ji methods.
translations.idiomatic: Then the emperor ordered the Grand Priest to establish these sacrifices in the southeast suburb of Chang'an, and regularly perform them according to Ji's methods.

sentences.zh: 其後人有上書，言「古者天子三年壹用太牢祠神三一：天一、地一、太一」。

translations.literal: After this someone submitted memorial, said "Ancient Son of Heaven three years one used great livestock sacrificed spirits three ones: heaven one, earth one, Tai Yi".
translations.idiomatic: After this, someone submitted a memorial saying: "In ancient times, the emperor once every three years used great livestock to sacrifice to the three supreme spirits: Heaven One, Earth One, and Tai Yi."

sentences.zh: 天子許之，令太祝領祠之於忌太一壇上，如其方。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven permitted it, ordered Grand Priest oversee sacrifice them on Ji Tai Yi altar, like their methods.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor approved this and ordered the Grand Priest to oversee sacrifices to them on Ji's Tai Yi altar, according to their methods.

sentences.zh: 後人復有上書，言「古者天子常以春解祠，祠黃帝用一梟破鏡；

translations.literal: Later people again submitted memorial, said "Ancient Son of Heaven constantly with spring solution sacrifice, sacrificed Yellow Emperor used one owl broken mirror;
translations.idiomatic: Later people again submitted a memorial saying: "In ancient times, the emperor constantly performed the spring solution sacrifices, sacrificing to the Yellow Emperor with one owl and a broken mirror;

sentences.zh: 冥羊用羊祠；

translations.literal: Dark sheep used sheep sacrifice;
translations.idiomatic: To the Dark Sheep with sheep sacrifices;

sentences.zh: 馬行用一青牡馬；

translations.literal: Horse travel used one blue stallion;
translations.idiomatic: To the Horse Travel with one blue stallion;

sentences.zh: 太一、澤山君地長用牛；

translations.literal: Tai Yi, Ze Mountain Lord Earth Length used oxen;
translations.idiomatic: To Tai Yi, the Lord of Ze Mountain, and Earth Length with oxen;

sentences.zh: 武夷君用乾魚；

translations.literal: Wuyi Lord used dried fish;
translations.idiomatic: To the Lord of Wuyi with dried fish;

sentences.zh: 陰陽使者以一牛」。

translations.literal: Yin yang messengers with one ox".
translations.idiomatic: To the yin-yang messengers with one ox."

sentences.zh: 令祠官領之如其方，而祠於忌太一壇旁。

translations.literal: Ordered sacrifice officials oversee them like their methods, and sacrificed beside Ji Tai Yi altar.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered the sacrifice officials to oversee them according to their methods, and sacrifices were performed beside Ji's Tai Yi altar.

sentences.zh: 其後，天子苑有白鹿，以其皮為幣，以發瑞應，造白金焉。

translations.literal: After this, Son of Heaven park had white deer, used its hide for currency, to issue auspicious responses, made white gold there.
translations.idiomatic: After this, a white deer appeared in the emperor's park; he used its hide to make currency to issue auspicious omens, and created white gold coins.

sentences.zh: 其明年，郊雍，獲一角獸，若麃然。

translations.literal: The next year, suburban Yong, obtained one horn beast, like muntjac there.
translations.idiomatic: The following year, during the suburban sacrifice at Yong, they obtained a one-horned beast that resembled a muntjac.

sentences.zh: 有司曰：「陛下肅祗郊祀，上帝報享，錫一角獸，蓋麟云。」

translations.literal: Officials said: "Your Majesty solemnly reverent suburban sacrifice, Supreme God responds enjoys, grants one horn beast, probably qilin it is said."
translations.idiomatic: The officials said: "Your Majesty has conducted the suburban sacrifice with solemn reverence; the Supreme God has responded favorably and granted a one-horned beast, which is probably a qilin."

sentences.zh: 於是以薦五畤，畤加一牛以燎。

translations.literal: Then used to offer five zhi, zhi added one ox to burn.
translations.idiomatic: Then he used it to make offerings at the five zhi altars, adding one ox to each for the burnt offering.

sentences.zh: 錫諸侯白金，風符應合于天也。

translations.literal: Granted feudal lords white gold, instructed omens responses accord with heaven also.
translations.idiomatic: He granted white gold to the feudal lords, instructing that the omens and responses should accord with heaven.

sentences.zh: 於是濟北王以為天子且封禪，乃上書獻太山及其旁邑，天子以他縣償之。

translations.literal: Then Ji Bei Wang thought Son of Heaven about to feng shan, then submitted memorial offered Tai Mountain and its neighboring settlements, Son of Heaven compensated with other counties.
translations.idiomatic: Then the King of Jibei, believing the emperor was about to perform feng and shan sacrifices, submitted a memorial offering Mount Tai and its neighboring settlements; the emperor compensated him with other counties.

sentences.zh: 常山王有罪，遷，天子封其弟於真定，以續先王祀，而以常山為郡，然後五岳皆在天子之（邦）［郡］。

translations.literal: Changshan Wang had crime, moved, Son of Heaven sealed his younger brother at Zhending, to continue previous king sacrifices, and made Changshan a commandery, then five peaks all in Son of Heaven's [commandery].
translations.idiomatic: The King of Changshan committed a crime and was moved; the emperor enfeoffed his younger brother at Zhending to continue the sacrifices to the previous king, and made Changshan a commandery, so that all five sacred mountains came under the emperor's [commanderies].

sentences.zh: 其明年，齊人少翁以鬼神方見上。

translations.literal: The next year, Qi person Shao Weng with ghost spirit methods appeared before emperor.
translations.idiomatic: The following year, Shao Weng from Qi appeared before the emperor with methods for communicating with ghosts and spirits.

sentences.zh: 上有所幸王夫人，夫人卒，少翁以方蓋夜致王夫人及灶鬼之貌云，天子自帷中望見焉。

translations.literal: Emperor had favored Wang lady, lady died, Shao Weng with methods secretly night summoned Wang lady and stove ghost appearances it is said, Son of Heaven from curtain middle saw them there.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor had a favored consort Lady Wang who died; Shao Weng used his methods to secretly summon the appearances of Lady Wang and the stove ghost at night, they say, and the emperor saw them from behind his curtain.

sentences.zh: 於是乃拜少翁為文成將軍，賞賜甚多，以客禮禮之。

translations.literal: Then then appointed Shao Weng as Wen Cheng general, rewards grants very many, with guest rites treated him.
translations.idiomatic: Then he appointed Shao Weng as General Wencheng, granting him many rewards and treating him with the rites due a guest.

sentences.zh: 文成言曰：「上即欲與神通，宮室被服非象神，神物不至。」

translations.literal: Wen Cheng said: "Emperor wishes to communicate with spirits, palace chambers clothing not imitate spirits, spirit things will not arrive."
translations.idiomatic: Wencheng said: "If the emperor wishes to communicate with the spirits, his palace chambers and clothing must imitate the spirits, otherwise spirit beings will not come."

sentences.zh: 乃作畫雲氣車，及各以勝日駕車辟惡鬼。

translations.literal: Then made painted cloud vapor chariots, and each with victory day drove chariot to ward off evil ghosts.
translations.idiomatic: Then he had painted chariots made that resembled cloud vapors, and had them driven on auspicious days to ward off evil spirits.

sentences.zh: 又作甘泉宮，中為臺室，畫天、地、太一諸鬼神，而置祭具以致天神。

translations.literal: Also made Gan Quan palace, middle made platform chambers, painted heaven, earth, Tai Yi various ghosts spirits, and placed sacrifice implements to bring heavenly spirits.
translations.idiomatic: He also built the Ganquan Palace, with platform chambers in the middle painted with heaven, earth, Tai Yi, and various ghosts and spirits, and placed sacrificial implements to summon heavenly spirits.

sentences.zh: 居歲餘，其方益衰，神不至。

translations.literal: After year remaining, his methods increasingly declined, spirits did not arrive.
translations.idiomatic: After more than a year, his methods grew increasingly ineffective, and the spirits did not come.

sentences.zh: 乃為帛書以飯牛，詳不知，言曰此牛腹中有奇。

translations.literal: Then made silk writing to feed ox, pretended not know, said this ox belly has strange thing.
translations.idiomatic: Then he made a document on silk and fed it to an ox, pretending not to know, and said that there was something strange in the ox's belly.

sentences.zh: 殺視得書，書言甚怪。

translations.literal: Killed inspected obtained writing, writing spoke very strange.
translations.idiomatic: They killed and examined the ox, obtaining the document, which spoke of very strange things.

sentences.zh: 天子識其手書，問其人，果是偽書，於是誅文成將軍，隱之。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven recognized his handwriting, asked its person, indeed was false writing, then executed Wen Cheng general, concealed it.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor recognized his handwriting and questioned him; indeed it was a forged document, so he executed General Wencheng but kept it secret.

sentences.zh: 其後則又作柏梁、銅柱、承露僊人掌之屬矣。

translations.literal: After this then also made Bai Liang, copper pillar, dew-catching immortal person hand and the like.
translations.idiomatic: After this, he also built the Bai Liang pavilion, copper pillars, dew-catching immortal figures, and the like.

sentences.zh: 文成死明年，天子病鼎湖甚，巫醫無所不致，不愈。

translations.literal: Wen Cheng died next year, Son of Heaven illness Ding Hu very, shamans doctors nothing not summoned, not healed.
translations.idiomatic: The year after Wencheng's death, the emperor fell gravely ill at Dinghu; he summoned shamans and doctors of every kind, but was not healed.

sentences.zh: 游水發根言上郡有巫，病而鬼神下之。

translations.literal: You Shui Fa Gen said Shang commandery had shaman, illness and ghosts spirits descended to her.
translations.idiomatic: You Shuifa Gen said that in Shang commandery there was a shaman who, when ill, had ghosts and spirits descend to her.

sentences.zh: 上召置祠之甘泉。

translations.literal: Emperor summoned placed sacrifice her at Gan Quan.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor summoned her and established sacrifices to her at Ganquan.

sentences.zh: 及病，使人問神君。

translations.literal: When ill, sent person asked divine lord.
translations.idiomatic: When he fell ill, he sent someone to consult the Divine Lord.

sentences.zh: 神君言曰：「天子無憂病。

translations.literal: Divine lord said: "Son of Heaven no worry illness.
translations.idiomatic: The Divine Lord said: "The emperor need not worry about his illness.

sentences.zh: 病少愈，彊與我會甘泉。」

translations.literal: Illness slightly healed, force to meet with me at Gan Quan."
translations.idiomatic: When his illness improves slightly, force yourself to meet with me at Ganquan."

sentences.zh: 於是病愈，遂起，幸甘泉，病良已。

translations.literal: Then illness healed, then rose, visited Gan Quan, illness well recovered.
translations.idiomatic: Then his illness was cured; he rose and visited Ganquan, where his illness was completely healed.

sentences.zh: 大赦，置壽宮神君。

translations.literal: Great amnesty, established longevity palace divine lord.
translations.idiomatic: He declared a great amnesty and established the Divine Lord in the Longevity Palace.

sentences.zh: 壽宮神君最貴者太一，其佐曰大禁、司命之屬，皆從之。

translations.literal: Longevity palace divine lord most honored Tai Yi, her assistants called Great Prohibition, Director of Fate and the like, all followed her.
translations.idiomatic: In the Longevity Palace, the most honored divine lord was Tai Yi, whose assistants were called the Great Prohibition, Director of Fate, and the like, all of whom followed her.

sentences.zh: 非可得見，聞其言，言與人音等。

translations.literal: Not could be seen, heard their words, words like human sounds equal.
translations.idiomatic: She could not be seen, but one could hear her words, which sounded just like a human voice.

sentences.zh: 時去時來，來則風肅然。

translations.literal: Sometimes left sometimes came, came then wind solemn there.
translations.idiomatic: She sometimes left and sometimes came; when she came, there was a solemn wind.

sentences.zh: 居室帷中。

translations.literal: Dwelt in chamber curtain middle.
translations.idiomatic: She dwelt within the curtains of the chamber.

sentences.zh: 時晝言，然常以夜。

translations.literal: Sometimes daytime spoke, but constantly at night.
translations.idiomatic: She sometimes spoke during the day, but constantly at night.

sentences.zh: 天子祓，然後入。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven purified, then entered.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor purified himself, then entered.

sentences.zh: 因巫為主人，關飲食。

translations.literal: Through shaman as host, managed eating drinking.
translations.idiomatic: He had the shaman act as hostess and manage the food and drink.

sentences.zh: 所以言，行下。

translations.literal: What she spoke of, carried out below.
translations.idiomatic: Whatever she spoke of was carried out below.

sentences.zh: 又置壽宮、北宮，張羽旗，設供具，以禮神君。

translations.literal: Also established longevity palace, north palace, spread feather flags, set up offering implements, to honor divine lord.
translations.idiomatic: He also established the Longevity Palace and North Palace, spread feather flags, and set up offering implements to honor the Divine Lord.

sentences.zh: 神君所言，上使人受書其言，命之曰「畫法」。

translations.literal: Divine lord's words, emperor caused person receive write her words, named them "painting methods".
translations.idiomatic: The emperor had someone receive and record the Divine Lord's words, calling them the "Painting Methods."

sentences.zh: 其所語，世俗之所知也，無絕殊者，而天子心獨喜。

translations.literal: What she spoke of, worldly common knowledge also, no extremely extraordinary ones, but emperor heart alone delighted.
translations.idiomatic: What she spoke of was common worldly knowledge, nothing extraordinarily unusual, yet the emperor's heart was uniquely delighted.

sentences.zh: 其事祕，世莫知也。

translations.literal: Her affairs secret, world none knew them.
translations.idiomatic: Her affairs were secret; the world knew nothing of them.

sentences.zh: 其後三年，有司言元宜以天瑞命，不宜以一二數。

translations.literal: After three years, officials said yuan should with heavenly auspicious sign named, not suitable with one two numbers.
translations.idiomatic: Three years later, the officials said that the yuan should be named according to heavenly auspicious signs, not by numbering them as one and two.

sentences.zh: 一元曰「建」，二元以長星曰「光」，三元以郊得一角獸曰「狩」云。

translations.literal: First yuan called "Build", second yuan with long star called "Light", third yuan with suburban obtained one horn beast called "Hunt" it is said.
translations.idiomatic: The first yuan was called "Build," the second yuan with the comet was called "Light," and the third yuan with the suburban one-horned beast was called "Hunt," they said.

sentences.zh: 其明年冬，天子郊雍，議曰：「今上帝朕親郊，而後土無祀，則禮不答也。」

translations.literal: The next year winter, Son of Heaven suburban Yong, discussed saying: "Now Supreme God I personally suburban sacrifice, but Hou Tu has no sacrifice, then rites not reciprocal also."
translations.idiomatic: The following winter, the emperor performed the suburban sacrifice at Yong and discussed: "Now I personally sacrifice to the Supreme God in the suburbs, but Hou Tu has no sacrifices; this makes the rites unbalanced."

sentences.zh: 有司與太史公、祠官寬舒議：「天地牲角繭栗。

translations.literal: Officials with Grand Historian, sacrifice official Kuanshu discussed: "Heaven earth sacrificial animals horns cocoon chestnut.
translations.idiomatic: The officials discussed with the Grand Historian and sacrifice official Kuanshu: "For heaven and earth, the sacrificial animals have horns like silkworm cocoons and chestnuts.

sentences.zh: 今陛下親祠后土，后土宜於澤中圜丘為五壇，壇一黃犢太牢具，已祠盡瘞，而從祠衣上黃。」

translations.literal: Now Your Majesty personally sacrifices Hou Tu, Hou Tu should in marsh middle round mound make five altars, altar one yellow calf great livestock complete, after sacrifice completely bury, and following sacrifice clothing upper yellow."
translations.idiomatic: Now Your Majesty personally sacrifices to Hou Tu; Hou Tu should have five altars in a round mound in the marshes, each altar with one yellow calf and complete great livestock offerings; after the sacrifice, bury everything completely, and the sacrificial clothing should be yellow above."

sentences.zh: 於是天子遂東，始立后土祠汾陰脽丘，如寬舒等議。

translations.literal: Then Son of Heaven then east, began establish Hou Tu sacrifice Fen Yin Wei Qiu, like Kuanshu etc. discussed.
translations.idiomatic: Then the emperor went east and began establishing the Hou Tu sacrifice at the Wei Qiu in Fen Yin, as Kuanshu and the others had discussed.

sentences.zh: 上親望拜，如上帝禮。

translations.literal: Emperor personally gazed bowed, like Supreme God rites.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor personally gazed and bowed, following the same rites as for the Supreme God.

sentences.zh: 禮畢，天子遂至滎陽而還。

translations.literal: Rites completed, Son of Heaven then went to Xing Yang and returned.
translations.idiomatic: When the rites were completed, the emperor then went to Xing Yang and returned.

sentences.zh: 過雒陽，下詔曰：「三代邈絕，遠矣難存。

translations.literal: Passed Luoyang, issued edict saying: "Three dynasties distant severed, far indeed difficult preserve.
translations.idiomatic: Passing through Luoyang, he issued an edict: "The Three Dynasties are long gone and distant; it is difficult to preserve them.

sentences.zh: 其以三十里地封周後為周子南君，以奉其先祀焉。」

translations.literal: Should with thirty li land enfeoff Zhou descendant as Zhou Zi Nan Jun, to maintain their ancestors' sacrifices there."
translations.idiomatic: I shall enfeoff the Zhou descendants with thirty li of land as the Lord of Zhou Zi Nan, to maintain their ancestral sacrifices there."

sentences.zh: 是歲，天子始巡郡縣，侵尋於泰山矣。

translations.literal: This year, Son of Heaven began touring commanderies counties, gradually approaching Mount Tai.
translations.idiomatic: That year, the emperor began touring the commanderies and counties, gradually approaching Mount Tai.

sentences.zh: 其春，樂成侯上書言欒大。

translations.literal: That spring, Yue Cheng Hou submitted memorial speaking of Luan Da.
translations.idiomatic: That spring, the Marquis of Yuecheng submitted a memorial speaking of Luan Da.

sentences.zh: 欒大，膠東宮人，故嘗與文成將軍同師，已而為膠東王尚方。

translations.literal: Luan Da, Jiao Dong palace person, formerly once with Wen Cheng general same teacher, then became Jiao Dong Wang's director of crafts.
translations.idiomatic: Luan Da was a palace attendant from Jiaodong; he had once studied under the same teacher as General Wencheng, and later became the director of crafts for the King of Jiaodong.

sentences.zh: 而樂成侯姊為康王后，無子。

translations.literal: And Yue Cheng Hou's elder sister was Kang Wang's queen, had no children.
translations.idiomatic: The Marquis of Yuecheng's elder sister was Queen to King Kang and had no children.

sentences.zh: 康王死，他姬子立為王。

translations.literal: Kang Wang died, other concubine's son established as king.
translations.idiomatic: When King Kang died, a son from another concubine was established as king.

sentences.zh: 而康后有淫行，與王不相中，相危以法。

translations.literal: And Kang Queen had licentious conduct, with king not harmonious, mutually threatened with law.
translations.idiomatic: Queen Kang had licentious conduct and was not on good terms with the king; they threatened each other with legal action.

sentences.zh: 康后聞文成已死，而欲自媚於上，乃遣欒大因樂成侯求見言方。

translations.literal: Kang Queen heard Wen Cheng already died, and wished to flatter herself to emperor, then sent Luan Da through Yue Cheng Hou seek audience speak methods.
translations.idiomatic: Queen Kang heard that Wencheng had died and wished to curry favor with the emperor, so she sent Luan Da through the Marquis of Yuecheng to seek an audience and speak of his methods.

sentences.zh: 天子既誅文成，後悔其蚤死，惜其方不盡，及見欒大，大說。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven having executed Wen Cheng, later regretted his early death, pitied his methods not exhausted, when saw Luan Da, greatly delighted.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor had executed Wencheng but later regretted his premature death and lamented that his methods were not fully obtained; when he saw Luan Da, he was greatly delighted.

sentences.zh: 大為人長美，言多方略，而敢為大言處之不疑。

translations.literal: Da as person tall handsome, speech many strategies, and dared make grand statements handle without doubt.
translations.idiomatic: Da was tall and handsome, his speech full of strategies, and he dared to make grand statements and handle matters without hesitation.

sentences.zh: 大言曰：「臣常往來海中，見安期、羨門之屬。

translations.literal: Da said: "Your servant constantly traveled sea middle, saw An Qi, Xian Men and the like.
translations.idiomatic: Da said: "Your servant constantly travels in the seas and has seen An Qi, Xian Men, and the like.

sentences.zh: 顧以臣為賤，不信臣。

translations.literal: But considered your servant base, did not believe your servant.
translations.idiomatic: But they considered your servant too lowly and did not believe me.

sentences.zh: 又以為康王諸侯耳，不足與方。

translations.literal: Also thought Kang Wang feudal lord only, not worth sharing methods with.
translations.idiomatic: They also thought King Kang was merely a feudal lord and not worth sharing methods with.

sentences.zh: 臣數言康王，康王又不用臣。

translations.literal: Your servant repeatedly spoke to Kang Wang, Kang Wang moreover did not use your servant.
translations.idiomatic: Your servant repeatedly spoke to King Kang, but King Kang would not employ me.

sentences.zh: 臣之師曰：『黃金可成，而河決可塞，不死之藥可得，僊人可致也。』

translations.literal: Your servant's teacher said: 'Gold can be formed, and Yellow River breach can be blocked, immortal medicine can be obtained, immortals can be brought.'
translations.idiomatic: My teacher said: 'Gold can be created, the Yellow River breach can be sealed, immortal medicine can be obtained, and immortals can be summoned.'

translations.literal: But your servant feared following Wen Cheng's example, then alchemists all shut mouths, how dare speak methods!"
translations.idiomatic: But your servant feared following Wencheng's example, for then all alchemists would keep their mouths shut—who would dare speak of methods anymore!"

sentences.zh: 上曰：「文成食馬肝死耳。

translations.literal: Emperor said: "Wen Cheng ate horse liver died only.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: "Wencheng only died from eating horse liver.

sentences.zh: 子誠能修其方，我何愛乎！」

translations.literal: If you truly can practice his methods, what would I begrudge!"
translations.idiomatic: If you can truly practice his methods, what would I hold back!"

sentences.zh: 大曰：「臣師非有求人，人者求之。

translations.literal: Da said: "Your servant's teacher not had sought people, people seek him.
translations.idiomatic: Da said: "My teacher did not seek out people; people sought him.

sentences.zh: 陛下必欲致之，則貴其使者，令有親屬，以客禮待之，勿卑，使各佩其信印，乃可使通言於神人。

translations.literal: If Your Majesty must summon him, then honor his envoys, cause them to have relatives, treat with guest rites, do not demean, make each wear their trust seal, then can cause to communicate words to divine people.
translations.idiomatic: If Your Majesty must summon him, then honor his envoys, give them relatives, treat them with the rites due guests, do not demean them, and have each wear their seal of trust; only then can they communicate with the divine beings.

sentences.zh: 神人尚肯邪不邪。

translations.literal: Divine people still willing or not willing.
translations.idiomatic: Whether the divine beings will be willing or not.

translations.literal: Summon by honoring their envoys, then can summon."
translations.idiomatic: Summon them by honoring their envoys; only then can they be summoned."

sentences.zh: 於是上使驗小方，鬬棋，棋自相觸擊。

translations.literal: Then emperor caused test small methods, fighting chess, chess pieces themselves mutually struck.
translations.idiomatic: Then the emperor had him test small methods; the fighting chess pieces moved and struck each other on their own.

sentences.zh: 是時上方憂河決，而黃金不就，乃拜大為五利將軍。

translations.literal: At this time emperor just worried Yellow River breach, and gold not completed, then appointed Da as Five Benefits general.
translations.idiomatic: At this time the emperor was worried about the Yellow River breach, and the gold was not yet complete, so he appointed Da as General of Five Benefits.

sentences.zh: 居月餘，得四印，佩天士將軍、地士將軍、大通將軍印。

translations.literal: After month remaining, obtained four seals, wore Heaven Gentleman general, Earth Gentleman general, Great Passage general seals.
translations.idiomatic: After more than a month, he obtained four seals, wearing those of General of Heaven Gentlemen, General of Earth Gentlemen, and General of Great Passage.

sentences.zh: 制詔御史：「昔禹疏九江，決四瀆。

translations.literal: Decree edict to imperial secretary: "Formerly Yu dredged nine Jiang, breached four Du.
translations.idiomatic: The decree to the imperial secretary stated: "Formerly Yu dredged the nine Jiang rivers and breached the four Du channels.

sentences.zh: 閒者河溢皋陸，隄繇不息。

translations.literal: Recently Yellow River overflowed Gao Lu, dike labor not ceased.
translations.idiomatic: Recently the Yellow River has overflowed Gao Lu, and the dike labor has not ceased.

sentences.zh: 朕臨天下二十有八年，天若遺朕士而大通焉。

translations.literal: I have faced the empire twenty eight years, heaven if bequeaths me gentleman and greatly connects there.
translations.idiomatic: I have ruled the empire for twenty-eight years; heaven, if it bequeaths me a gentleman, will greatly connect him to me.

sentences.zh: 乾稱『蜚龍』，『鴻漸于般』，朕意庶幾與焉。

translations.literal: Qian calls 'flying dragon', 'great goose gradually to plate', my intent perhaps participates there.
translations.idiomatic: The Qian hexagram speaks of the 'flying dragon' and the 'great goose gradually ascending the plate'; my intent perhaps participates in this.

sentences.zh: 其以二千戶封地士將軍大為樂通侯。」

translations.literal: Should with two thousand households enfeoff Earth Gentleman general Da as Le Tong marquis."
translations.idiomatic: I shall enfeoff General of Earth Gentlemen Da with two thousand households as the Marquis of Le Tong."

sentences.zh: 賜列侯甲第，僮千人。

translations.literal: Granted liehou first rank residence, youths thousand.
translations.idiomatic: He was granted a first-rank residence befitting a marquis, along with a thousand servants.

sentences.zh: 乘轝斥車馬帷幄器物以充其家。

translations.literal: Riding carriage outspread chariots horses canopies curtains implements to fill his household.
translations.idiomatic: He was given carriages, chariots, horses, canopies, curtains, and implements to fill his household.

sentences.zh: 又以衛長公主妻之，齎金萬斤，更命其邑曰當利公主。

translations.literal: Also with Wei eldest princess married him, granted gold ten thousand jin, moreover named his settlement Dang Li princess.
translations.idiomatic: He was also married to the eldest princess of Wei, granted ten thousand jin of gold, and his settlement was moreover named Dangli Princess.

sentences.zh: 天子親如五利之第。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven personally went to Five Benefits residence.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor personally visited the residence of Five Benefits.

sentences.zh: 使者存問供給，相屬於道。

translations.literal: Envoys inquired after provided supplies, continuously on the road.
translations.idiomatic: Imperial envoys continuously inquired after him and provided supplies along the road.

sentences.zh: 自大主將相以下，皆置酒其家，獻遺之。

translations.literal: From great princess generals ministers below, all set up wine in his home, presented gifts to him.
translations.idiomatic: From the great princess and generals and ministers below, all hosted wine feasts in his home and presented him with gifts.

sentences.zh: 於是天子又刻玉印曰「天道將軍」，使使衣羽衣，夜立白茅上，五利將軍亦衣羽衣，夜立白茅上受印，以示不臣也。

translations.literal: Then Son of Heaven also carved jade seal called "Heaven Dao general", caused envoy wear feather clothing, night stand on white thatch, Five Benefits general also wear feather clothing, night stand on white thatch receive seal, to show not subject.
translations.idiomatic: Then the emperor also carved a jade seal calling him "General of the Heavenly Dao," had the envoy wear feather garments and stand on white thatch at night; the General of Five Benefits also wore feather garments and stood on white thatch at night to receive the seal, to show he was not a subject.

sentences.zh: 而佩「天道」者，且為天子道天神也。

translations.literal: And wearing "Heaven Dao", moreover for Son of Heaven guides heavenly spirits.
translations.idiomatic: And one who wears the "Heavenly Dao" moreover guides heavenly spirits for the emperor.

sentences.zh: 於是五利常夜祠其家，欲以下神。

translations.literal: Then Five Benefits constantly night sacrificed in his home, wished to summon spirits.
translations.idiomatic: Then Five Benefits constantly performed night sacrifices in his home, wishing to summon spirits.

sentences.zh: 神未至而百鬼集矣，然頗能使之。

translations.literal: Spirits not yet arrived but hundred ghosts gathered, yet quite able to command them.
translations.idiomatic: The spirits had not yet arrived but a hundred ghosts had gathered; yet he was quite able to command them.

sentences.zh: 其後裝治行，東入海，求其師云。

translations.literal: After that prepared regulated journey, east entered sea, sought his teacher it is said.
translations.idiomatic: After that he prepared and set out on a journey, going east into the sea to seek his teacher, they say.

sentences.zh: 大見數月，佩六印，貴震天下，而海上燕齊之閒，莫不搤捥而自言有禁方，能神僊矣。

translations.literal: Da appeared several months, wore six seals, noble shook the empire, and seacoast Yan Qi between, none not clutched sleeves and claimed had forbidden methods, could divine immortals.
translations.idiomatic: Da had appeared for several months, wore six seals, his nobility shook the empire, and between the seacoast regions of Yan and Qi, everyone clutched their sleeves and claimed to have forbidden methods and the ability to become divine immortals.

sentences.zh: 其夏六月中，汾陰巫錦為民祠魏脽后土營旁，見地如鉤狀，掊視得鼎。

translations.literal: That summer sixth month middle, Fen Yin shaman Jin for people sacrificed Wei Wei Hou Tu camp beside, saw ground like hook shape, dug inspected obtained ding.
translations.idiomatic: In the middle of the sixth month of that summer, the shaman Jin from Fen Yin was sacrificing to Hou Tu at the Wei Qiu for the people beside the camp, when he saw the ground in a hook-like shape; digging and inspecting, he obtained a ding.

sentences.zh: 鼎大異於眾鼎，文鏤無款識，怪之，言吏。

translations.literal: Ding greatly different from crowd dings, patterns engraved without inscriptions, considered strange, told officials.
translations.idiomatic: The ding was greatly different from ordinary tripods, its patterns engraved but without inscriptions; they considered it strange and reported it to the officials.

sentences.zh: 吏告河東太守勝，勝以聞。

translations.literal: Officials told Hedong governor Sheng, Sheng reported it.
translations.idiomatic: The officials told Governor Sheng of Hedong, who reported it upward.

sentences.zh: 天子使使驗問巫得鼎無姦詐，乃以禮祠，迎鼎至甘泉，從行，上薦之。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven sent envoy verified questioned shaman obtained ding no deceit fraud, then with rites sacrificed, welcomed ding to Gan Quan, followed journey, emperor offered it.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor sent an envoy to verify and question the shaman about obtaining the ding, finding no deceit or fraud; then he sacrificed to it with proper rites, welcomed the ding to Ganquan, followed on the journey, and the emperor offered sacrifices to it.

sentences.zh: 至中山，曣溫，有黃云蓋焉。

translations.literal: Arrived Zhongshan, heat warm, had yellow cloud cover there.
translations.idiomatic: When they arrived at Zhongshan, it was warm and clear, with yellow clouds covering overhead.

sentences.zh: 有麃過，上自射之，因以祭云。

translations.literal: Had muntjac pass by, emperor personally shot it, then used to sacrifice it is said.
translations.idiomatic: A muntjac passed by, and the emperor personally shot it, then used it for sacrifice, they say.

sentences.zh: 至長安，公卿大夫皆議請尊寶鼎。

translations.literal: Arrived Chang'an, ministers dukes grand masters all discussed petitioned to honor treasure ding.
translations.idiomatic: When they arrived at Chang'an, all the ministers, dukes, and grand masters discussed and petitioned to honor the treasure ding.

sentences.zh: 天子曰：「閒者河溢，歲數不登，故巡祭后土，祈為百姓育穀。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven said: "Recently Yellow River overflowed, years several not good harvest, therefore toured sacrificed Hou Tu, prayed for common people grow grain.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: "Recently the Yellow River has overflowed, and for several years the harvests have been poor; therefore I toured and sacrificed to Hou Tu, praying that the common people might grow grain.

sentences.zh: 今歲豐廡未報，鼎曷為出哉？」

translations.literal: Now year abundant rich not yet repaid, ding why emerge?"
translations.idiomatic: Now that the year is abundant and rich, the debt not yet repaid—why has the ding emerged?"

sentences.zh: 有司皆曰：「聞昔泰帝興神鼎一，一者壹統，天地萬物所系終也。

translations.literal: Officials all said: "Heard formerly Tai Di raised divine ding one, one is unify, heaven earth myriad things tied end also.
translations.idiomatic: All the officials said: "We have heard that formerly the Supreme Emperor raised one divine ding; 'one' means unification, the end to which heaven, earth, and the myriad things are all tied.

sentences.zh: 黃帝作寶鼎三，象天地人。

translations.literal: Yellow Emperor made treasure dings three, symbolized heaven earth human.
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow Emperor made three treasure dings, symbolizing heaven, earth, and humanity.

sentences.zh: 禹收九牧之金，鑄九鼎。

translations.literal: Yu collected nine regions' metal, cast nine dings.
translations.idiomatic: Yu collected metal from the nine regions and cast nine dings.

sentences.zh: 皆嘗亨鬺上帝鬼神。

translations.literal: All once cooked offered Supreme God ghosts spirits.
translations.idiomatic: All of them were once used to cook and offer to the Supreme God and ghosts and spirits.

sentences.zh: 遭聖則興，鼎遷于夏商。

translations.literal: Met sages then rose, dings moved to Xia Shang.
translations.idiomatic: When sages appeared they rose up; the dings moved to Xia and Shang.

sentences.zh: 周德衰，宋之社亡，鼎乃淪沒，伏而不見。

translations.literal: Zhou virtue declined, Song's altar perished, dings then submerged, hidden not seen.
translations.idiomatic: When Zhou's virtue declined and Song's altar perished, the dings then submerged and remained hidden, unseen.

sentences.zh: 頌云『自堂徂基，自羊徂牛；

translations.literal: Ode says 'from hall to foundation, from sheep to ox;
translations.idiomatic: The ode says: 'From hall to foundation, from sheep to ox;

translations.idiomatic: Nai dings and zun vessels, not Wu not Jiao—how to examine its good fortune.'"

sentences.zh: 今鼎至甘泉，光潤龍變，承休無疆。

translations.literal: Now ding arrived Gan Quan, light moist dragon changed, received good fortune boundless.
translations.idiomatic: Now the ding has arrived at Ganquan, radiant and moist, transforming like a dragon, receiving boundless good fortune.

sentences.zh: 合茲中山，有黃白云降蓋，若獸為符，路弓乘矢，集獲壇下，報祠大享。

translations.literal: Met this Zhongshan, had yellow white clouds descend cover, like beast for omen, road bows multiplied arrows, gathered obtained altar below, repaid sacrifice great feast.
translations.idiomatic: Meeting this at Zhongshan, yellow and white clouds descended and covered it, like a beast as an omen; bows and multiplied arrows along the road gathered and obtained below the altar, repaying with great sacrificial feasts.

sentences.zh: 唯受命而帝者心知其意而合德焉。

translations.literal: Only received mandate became emperor ones heart know its intent and matched virtue there.
translations.idiomatic: Only those who received the mandate and became emperors know its intent in their hearts and match its virtue.

sentences.zh: 鼎宜見於祖禰，藏於帝廷，以合明應。」

translations.literal: Ding should appear at ancestral temples, stored in imperial court, to match bright response."
translations.idiomatic: The ding should appear at the ancestral temples and be stored in the imperial court, to match the bright response."

sentences.zh: 制曰：「可。」

translations.literal: Decree said: "Approved."
translations.idiomatic: The decree stated: "Approved."

sentences.zh: 入海求蓬萊者，言蓬萊不遠，而不能至者，殆不見其氣。

translations.literal: Entered sea sought Penglai ones, said Penglai not far, but cannot reach ones, probably not seen its vapor.
translations.idiomatic: Those who entered the sea seeking Penglai said it was not far, but those who could not reach it probably did not see its vapors.

sentences.zh: 上乃遣望氣佐候其氣云。

translations.literal: Emperor then sent observe vapor assistant await its vapor it is said.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor then sent an assistant skilled in observing vapors to await its vapors, they say.

sentences.zh: 其秋，上幸雍，且郊。

translations.literal: That autumn, emperor visited Yong, about to suburban sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: That autumn, the emperor visited Yong and was about to perform the suburban sacrifice.

sentences.zh: 或曰「五帝，太一之佐也，宜立太一而上親郊之」。

translations.literal: Some said "Five emperors, Tai Yi's assistants also, should establish Tai Yi and emperor personally suburban sacrifice it".
translations.idiomatic: Some said: "The Five Emperors are Tai Yi's assistants; we should establish Tai Yi and have the emperor personally perform the suburban sacrifice to it."

sentences.zh: 上疑未定。

translations.literal: Emperor doubted not decided.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor was doubtful and undecided.

sentences.zh: 齊人公孫卿曰：「今年得寶鼎，其冬辛巳朔旦冬至，與黃帝時等。」

translations.literal: Qi person Gongsun Qing said: "This year obtained treasure ding, that winter Xin Si first day winter solstice, matched Yellow Emperor time equal."
translations.idiomatic: Gongsun Qing from Qi said: "This year we obtained the treasure ding; that winter on the Xin Si day, the first day of the month and winter solstice, matches the time of the Yellow Emperor."

sentences.zh: 卿有札書曰：「黃帝得寶鼎宛朐，問於鬼臾區。

translations.literal: Qing had bamboo book said: "Yellow Emperor obtained treasure ding Wan Qu, asked Gui Yu Qu.
translations.idiomatic: Qing had a bamboo book that said: "The Yellow Emperor obtained the treasure ding at Wan Qu and asked Gui Yu Qu about it.

sentences.zh: 鬼臾區對曰：『［黃］帝得寶鼎神策，是歲己酉朔旦冬至，得天之紀，終而復始。』

translations.literal: Gui Yu Qu replied: "[Yellow] Emperor obtained treasure ding divine strategy, this year Ji You first day winter solstice, obtained heaven's order, ended and began again."
translations.idiomatic: Gui Yu Qu replied: "The Yellow Emperor obtained the treasure ding and divine strategy; that year on the Ji You day, first day of the month and winter solstice, he obtained heaven's order, which ends and begins again."

sentences.zh: 於是黃帝迎日推策，後率二十歲復朔旦冬至，凡二十推，三百八十年，黃帝僊登于天。」

translations.literal: Then Yellow Emperor welcomed sun calculated strategy, later rate twenty years returned first day winter solstice, altogether twenty calculations, three hundred eighty years, Yellow Emperor immortal ascended to heaven."
translations.idiomatic: Then the Yellow Emperor welcomed the sun and calculated the strategy; later every twenty years it returned to the first day of the month and winter solstice; altogether twenty calculations, three hundred eighty years, and the Yellow Emperor ascended to heaven as an immortal."

sentences.zh: 卿因所忠欲奏之。

translations.literal: Qing through Suo Zhong wished to memorial it.
translations.idiomatic: Qing wished to submit it through Suo Zhong.

sentences.zh: 所忠視其書不經，疑其妄書，謝曰：「寶鼎事已決矣，尚何以為！」

translations.literal: Suo Zhong saw its book not classical, suspected its false book, declined said: "Treasure ding matter already decided, still what to do!"
translations.idiomatic: Suo Zhong saw that the book was not classical and suspected it was a forgery; he declined, saying: "The treasure ding matter has already been decided; what more is there to do!"

sentences.zh: 卿因嬖人奏之。

translations.literal: Qing through favored person memorialed it.
translations.idiomatic: Qing submitted it through a favored attendant.

sentences.zh: 上大說，乃召問卿。

translations.literal: Emperor greatly delighted, then summoned questioned Qing.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor was greatly delighted and summoned Qing for questioning.

sentences.zh: 對曰：「受此書申公，申公已死。」

translations.literal: Replied: "Received this book Shen Gong, Shen Gong already dead."
translations.idiomatic: He replied: "I received this book from Shen Gong, but Shen Gong has already died."

sentences.zh: 上曰：「申公何人也？」

translations.literal: Emperor said: "Shen Gong what person?"
translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: "Who is Shen Gong?"

sentences.zh: 卿曰：「申公，齊人。

translations.literal: Qing said: "Shen Gong, Qi person.
translations.idiomatic: Qing said: "Shen Gong was from Qi.

translations.literal: Communicated with An Qisheng, received Yellow Emperor words, no book, only had this ding book.
translations.idiomatic: He communicated with An Qisheng and received the words of the Yellow Emperor; there were no books, only this ding book.

sentences.zh: 曰『漢興復當黃帝之時』。

translations.literal: Said 'Han rise again should Yellow Emperor time'.
translations.idiomatic: It said: 'When Han rises again it will be like the time of the Yellow Emperor.'

sentences.zh: 曰『漢之聖者在高祖之孫且曾孫也。

translations.literal: Said 'Han sage is in Gaozu grandson and great-grandson also.
translations.idiomatic: It said: 'The sage of Han will be among Gaozu's grandson and great-grandson.

sentences.zh: 寶鼎出而與神通，封禪。

translations.literal: Treasure ding emerges and communicates with spirits, feng shan.
translations.idiomatic: The treasure ding will emerge and communicate with the spirits, performing feng and shan.

sentences.zh: 封禪七十二王，唯黃帝得上泰山封』。

translations.literal: Feng shan seventy-two kings, only Yellow Emperor got ascend Mount Tai feng'."
translations.idiomatic: Of the seventy-two kings who performed feng and shan, only the Yellow Emperor was able to ascend Mount Tai for the feng.'"

sentences.zh: 申公曰：『漢主亦當上封，上封能僊登天矣。

translations.literal: Shen Gong said: 'Han ruler also should ascend feng, ascend feng can immortal ascend heaven.
translations.idiomatic: Shen Gong said: 'The Han ruler should also ascend for the feng; ascending for the feng enables one to ascend to heaven as an immortal.

sentences.zh: 黃帝時萬諸侯，而神靈之封居七千。

translations.literal: Yellow Emperor time ten thousand feudal lords, and divine spirits feng resided seven thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the Yellow Emperor's time there were ten thousand feudal lords, and the feng of divine spirits numbered seven thousand.

sentences.zh: 天下名山八，而三在蠻夷，五在中國。

translations.literal: World famous mountains eight, and three in barbarian Yi, five in central states.
translations.idiomatic: There are eight famous mountains in the world, with three in the barbarian Yi regions and five in the central states.

translations.literal: Central states Hua Mountain, Shou Mountain, Tai Shi, Mount Tai, Dong Lai, these five mountains Yellow Emperor place constantly traveled, met with spirits.
translations.idiomatic: The mountains of the central states—Hua Mountain, Shou Mountain, Tai Shi, Mount Tai, Dong Lai—these five mountains were where the Yellow Emperor constantly traveled and met with the spirits.

sentences.zh: 黃帝且戰且學僊。

translations.literal: Yellow Emperor while fighting while learned immortality.
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow Emperor learned immortality while fighting wars.
